Column Comment.0: LEGAL LOCATION ID: unique identifier for the legal location
Column Comment.1: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of obj ect being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.5: AREA TYPE: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, county, district,province, state, city, geographic, geologic etc.
Column Comment.6: CONGRESSIONAL LOT NUMBER: Number assigned to a lot in the Congressionalsurvey system.
Column Comment.7: CONGRESS RANGE: Number designating a whole or partial range division east orwest of the principal meridian.
Column Comment.8: CONGRESS SECTION: Number designating the section within a township, 1-36.
Column Comment.9: CONGRESS SECTION SUFFIX: Letter suffix identifying the sub section with asection. e.g., 23A
Column Comment.10: CONGRESS TOWNSHIP: Number designating the township division north or southof the baseline.
Column Comment.11: CONGRESS TOWNSHIP NAME: The full legal name of the township if located inMichigan state.
Column Comment.12: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.13: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.14: EAST-WEST DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid East-West directions.For example, East, West.
Column Comment.15: EAST WEST FOOTAGE: Distance measured in feet, from a east or west referenceline to the well location (e.g., 660FEL).
Column Comment.16: EAST WEST FOOTAGE OUOM: East/West footage original unit of measure.
Column Comment.17: EAST-WEST START LINE: The east-west starting lines for offset distances. Thesedescriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such as Texassurveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FEL (first east line),NEL (northmost east line),...
Column Comment.18: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.19: FOOTAGE ORIGIN: The point of origin used in measuring the survey footage calls toa well location.
Column Comment.20: NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid north-southDirections. For example, North, South.
Column Comment.21: NORTH SOUTH FOOTAGE: Distance measured in feet, from a north or southreference line to the well location (e.g., 660FNL).
Column Comment.22: NORTH SOUTH FOOTAGE OUOM: North/South footage original unit of measure.
Column Comment.23: NORTH-SOUTH START LINE: The north-south starting lines for offset distances.These descriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such asTexas surveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FSL (first southline), ESL (eastmost south line), ...
Column Comment.24: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.25: PRINICPAL MERIDIAN CODE: A reference table identifying the valid principalmeridians used for legal survey descriptions. This is the f irst meridian in the surveyfrom which all other meridians are numbere d. For example Black Hi lls 1878, Boise1867, Chicksaw 1833, ...
Column Comment.26: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.27: SCALED FOOTAGE INDICATOR: A yes / no flag indicating that the operator filedpermit/plat well location footage is different from the clients interpreted mappedfootage. In this case, the clients well location footage is indicated as scaled footage.
Column Comment.28: SECTION TYPE: Entries in this column identify valid types of section or equivalentblocks. For example, block, bay, survey, militia donation, Michigan road land section,...
Column Comment.29: SPOT CODE: Code identifying a quartered division of a section, also known asthealiquot description (e.g., NW SE NE, C SW, etc.).
Column Comment.30: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.31: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)
Column Comment.32: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.33: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.34: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.35: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.36: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.37: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.38: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
